security_audit.summary: Standard development tooling for building React-based artifacts. All static findings are false positives: LICENSE.txt was misidentified (license URLs flagged as 'network', legal text as 'weak crypto'), CSS hsl() colors flagged as 'weak crypto', and documentation text flagged as 'system reconnaissance'. The scripts perform legitimate project initialization, dependency installation from npmjs.com, and file modifications for project configuration. No data exfiltration, no malicious behavior, and all capabilities align with the stated purpose.

content.user_title: Build complex HTML artifacts with React and shadcn/ui
content.value_statement: Creating sophisticated HTML artifacts for Claude conversations requires complex tooling. This skill provides a complete development workflow with React, Vite, and shadcn/ui components to build, bundle, and share professional-grade artifacts.
actual_capabilities: Initialize React + TypeScript projects with Vite
Install and configure Tailwind CSS with shadcn/ui theming
Bundle complete React apps into single HTML files
Set up path aliases and TypeScript configuration
Build artifacts compatible with Claude conversations
limitations: Requires Node.js 18 or higher and pnpm package manager
Cannot build simple single-file HTML or JSX artifacts
Generated artifacts must be manually shared in conversations

best_practices: Initialize projects with descriptive names that indicate artifact purpose
Use shadcn/ui components to maintain visual consistency
Bundle artifacts only after development is complete to reduce latency
Test artifacts in browser before sharing in conversations
anti_patterns: Avoid excessive centered layouts and purple gradients (AI slop)
Do not use Inter font with default styling
Avoid uniform rounded corners on all elements
Do not bundle incomplete artifacts with development dependencies

faq.question: Which AI platforms support these artifacts?
faq.answer: Artifacts work with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. They display as interactive HTML in conversations.

faq.question: What are the size limits for artifacts?
faq.answer: Single HTML files should remain under 2MB for optimal loading. Complex apps may need code splitting.

faq.question: Can I use this with existing React projects?
faq.answer: Yes. Run init-artifact.sh in an existing Vite project to add shadcn/ui support and configuration.

faq.question: Is my data safe when building artifacts?
faq.answer: Yes. All processing happens locally. Dependencies install from npmjs.com. No data leaves your machine.

faq.question: Why is my artifact not displaying correctly?
faq.answer: Ensure index.html exists in project root. Run bundle-artifact.sh from project directory. Check browser console.

faq.question: How is this different from simple HTML artifacts?
faq.answer: This skill handles complex React apps with state, routing, and many components. Simple artifacts use basic HTML/JSX only.
